subject: RE: [junit] JUnit 4 RFE: expected=name
msgSnippet: ... That s what you had to do, because expected needed to be a String and at runtime there is no information about the imports of the compilation unit
messageBody:
> Package issues might make this difficult. I.e. I would not want to
> have to type
>
> @Test(expected=java.lang.ArithmeticException) public void
> divideByZero() { int n = 2 / 0;
> }

That's what you had to do, because expected needed to be a String and at
runtime there is no information about the imports of the compilation unit
available. Actually, you had to additonally put the class name into quotes.

Cheers, Ilja
